labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Zotero MCP" is designed to enhance research workflows by integrating a user's Zotero library with AI assistants like Claude. It provides tools to search, retrieve, and analyze research papers, metadata, annotations, notes, and more within the Zotero ecosystem. The core functionality revolves around managing and interacting with academic research materials, enabling features like summarization, citation analysis, and discussion of papers with AI.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is selected based on the server's core function of aiding research workflows, particularly around academic papers. Secondary labels are chosen because the tools also involve searching for items, notes, and collections, as well as batch operations on tags. The custom label is added to highlight the unique integration of AI with research libraries, which is a distinctive feature not fully captured by predefined categories.

server_info_crawled.name: Zotero MCP
server_info_crawled.author: @54yyyu/zotero-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Connect your Zotero research library with AI assistants to discuss papers, get summaries, and analyze citations. Enhance your research workflow by seamlessly integrating your library with Claude and other tools.

tools.name: zotero_search_items
tools.description: Deploy Server @54yyyu/zotero-mcp Try in Playground zotero_search_items

tools.name: zotero_get_item_metadata
tools.description: Get detailed metadata for a specific Zotero item by its key.

tools.name: zotero_get_item_fulltext
tools.description: Get the full text content of a Zotero item by its key.

tools.name: zotero_get_collections
tools.description: List all collections in your Zotero library.

tools.name: zotero_get_collection_items
tools.description: Get all items in a specific Zotero collection.

tools.name: zotero_get_item_children
tools.description: Get all child items (attachments, notes) for a specific Zotero item.

tools.name: zotero_get_tags
tools.description: Get all tags used in your Zotero library.

tools.name: zotero_get_recent
tools.description: Get recently added items to your Zotero library.

tools.name: zotero_batch_update_tags
tools.description: Batch update tags across multiple items matching a search query.

tools.name: zotero_advanced_search
tools.description: Perform an advanced search with multiple criteria.

tools.name: zotero_get_annotations
tools.description: Get all annotations for a specific item or across your entire Zotero library.

tools.name: zotero_get_notes
tools.description: Retrieve notes from your Zotero library, with options to filter by parent item.

tools.name: zotero_search_notes
tools.description: Search for notes across your Zotero library.

tools.name: zotero_create_note
tools.description: Create a new note for a Zotero item.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "zoteroLocal": true,
  "zoteroLibraryType": "user"
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@54yyyu/zotero-mcp/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
